TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListViewItem extends System.Web.UI.Control implements class System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer, class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Represents an individual item in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ListViewItem class is used to represent an individual item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. An individual item usually represents a record in the underlying data source of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
Each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control has a designated item type, as listed in the following table.
|Item type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType>|A data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType>|An insert item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType>|An empty item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. The empty item is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any records to display, or when a group in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any more records to display.|
To determine the type of a ListViewItem object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A> property.
If an item contains other controls, you can retrieve a control by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the item. If the control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property is set, you can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method to find the control.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of ListViewItem, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the ListViewItem class to access the properties of the item that is being created in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.
> [!IMPORTANT] > This example has a text box that accepts user input, which is a potential security threat. By default, ASP.NET Web pages validate that user input does not include script or HTML elements. For more information, see [Script Exploits Overview](../Topic/Script%20Exploits%20Overview.md).
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_190_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_190_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> class.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem.ItemType%2A>|The value of the `itemType` parameter.|

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object DataItem { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the underlying data object that the object is bound to.
Docs.value: The underlying data object that the object is bound to.

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the data item that is bound to the control.
Docs.value: The index of the data item that is bound to the control.

Docs.summary: Gets the position of the data item as displayed in the control.
Docs.value: The position of the data item as displayed in the control.

Docs.summary: Gets the item type of the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ItemType property to determine the type of item that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> object represents, as listed in the following table.
|Item type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType>|A data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType>|An insert item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItemType>|An empty item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control. The empty item is displayed when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any records to display, or when a group in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control does not have any more records to display.|
You typically use this property to determine an item's type before you perform an operation.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the ItemType property to determine whether the item that is being created is a data item. If the item is a data item, the e-mail address is displayed in italic. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_291_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListViewItem#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_291_1.aspx)]
